alert.note: Alert for Northeast Aroostook; Northwest Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 22 at 3:17AM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...A line of thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Aroostook County through 400 AM EDT... At 316 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of thunderstorms 7 miles northwest of Dickey, or 10 miles northwest of Allagash, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fort Kent, Madawaska, Van Buren, Eagle Lake, Allagash, Deboullie Mountain, Frenchville, New Canada, Allagash Township, Lille, Cross Lake, Dickey, Madawaska Lake, Wallagrass, Grand Isle, Stockholm, Winterville, Sinclair, Soldier Pond and Saint Francis. This includes the following highways... US Highway 1 between Van Buren and Fort Kent. State Highway 11 between Eagle Lake and Fort Kent. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
